name: Ancestors
description: The ability to channel the knowledge and skills of those Garou who have gone before.

name: Fate
description: A prophecy surrounding you and your pack that you will fulfill.

name: Fetish
description: You have an item of some sort with a spirit bound within it, giving it supernatural powers.

name: Kinfolk
description: Relatives who you are in touch with, human and wolf, who are immune to the Delirium.

name: Pure Breed
description: You have the blood of a Garou hero in your veins, and others can see it within you.

name: Rites
description: You know a number of rites, rituals empowered with spirit magic.

name: Spirit Heritage
description: You have the touch of a particular type of spirit on you, and they treat you as their own.

name: Den-Realm
description: A supernatural pocket realm in the Umbra that a Bastet has access to.

name: Mnesis
description: A supernatural ability to recall past lives and experiences held by the Mokole.

name: Wallow
description: Ties to a Mokole wallow homestead where others of your kind live.

name: Ananta
description: A Nagah's supernatural Den-Realm that exists in the Umbra, containing everything that the Nagah requires.

name: Secrets
description: Information that would be considered desireable - or damaging - to someone else.

name: Umbral Maps
description: A wealth of experience and received information about Umbral navigation, dangers, and travel.

name: Batsu
description: A Batsu are the Kitsune's closest allies and friends, with whom they keep a very special and tight bond. Most Kitsune are part of a Batsu of a few kitsune. This is a relationship similar to that of many trio, quartets or even quintets that populate East Asian mythology and fiction. It is comparable to the Allies Background, but involves a much deeper relationship.

name: Kitsune Clan
description: The Clan of a Kitsune is a group of family, kin and friends who know the truth about werefoxes and their purpose. This includes many Kinfolk, but also regular humans who are chosen with great care as trustful allies. After all not inducing Delirium has also some advantages. This replaces the Kinfolk Background for Kitsune.

name: Go-En
description: This represents a network of minor contacts that a Kitsune uses, instead of relying on a singular major contact, so they can have multiple sources of information on various topics. Kitsune may make Contacts rolls to find someone to aid them in any given endeavor at a Difficulty of 5, rather than 7.

name: Sempai
description: A Sempai is essentially comparable to a Mentor for a Kitsune, with some differences. A Kitsune can also have a group of Hengeyokai as mentors. Such Mentor can be an uncle or an aunt (or both), a Kitsune parent, a court sentai (a group) that adopts the Kitsune as a mascot, or a ranking official of a Beast Court. Four dots of Sempai are equivalent to a five-tailed Kitsune Sempai, and five dots to a six-tailed one.

name: Jamak
description: A Jamak (plural Jamaa) is a personal Totem usually found in the company of a Bastet. While some are large enough to need a group of the werecats to ally with, many are quite happy to ally themselves with a single feline.
